intro: Geniosporum menthoides, commonly known as the mintleaf goosefoot, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, mint-scented leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid environments. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, round seeds. Due to its unique appearance and ecological adaptations, it is often found in disturbed or open habitats.
